ygData.subject: RE: OMG! Abashi changes his tune
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes, I have to agree.  My enchanter has died a grand total of 9 times up to 18th level.  My bard lost 16th level 5 times by comparison.  Casters in my guild
ygData.messageBody:
Yes, I have to agree. My enchanter has died a grand total of 9 times up to
18th level. My bard lost 16th level 5 times by comparison. Casters in my
guild nearly never die, while the hybrids die a lot. We don't have but one
melee'r left sadly as they all got tired of dying 10 times as much as the
casters and restarted as casters or at least hybrids. Norrath, Its a cast
or die world berk!

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: silky@... [mailto:silky@...]
Sent: Thursday, January 27, 2000 2:29 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] OMG! Abashi changes his tune


From: silky@...

At 12:09 PM 1/26/00 -0500, you wrote:
>From: <kim@...>
>
>On Wed, 26 Jan 2000 silky@... wrote:
>>
>> Hmmm, awhile back I posted some tips on how bards can use bard hatred to
>> their advantage to help level up lower players very quickly. At that
time
>> - I predicted if Verant ever figured this out......
>>
>> Things that make ya go hmmmmm.
>
>Well, after you get charm, you quickly figure out that the
>easiest way to help level up lower level players is to beat
>something to almost dead, charm it, and let them finish it
>off. Changing bard hatred won't affect that any.

True - never got my bard quite to charm - almost. Chains and lullaby were
all I ever needed to help the really low level guys powerlevel like fiends
- thank you bard hatred.

The last month or so - been on the (almost) newest server as a wizard.
Gotta say - casters die more often???? Uhhhh - not my wizard. If I die once
a level - I have really screwed up. With my bard - it was more like once a
night. Seriously considering starting a bard on this server there aren't
many - and the ones I've run across are new bards - and not terribly well
versed in what a bard is really all about.
